definition: to continue/to follow after/to go on with/to succeed/to inherit/then/afterwards
surname Cheng/Cheng (c. 2000 BC), third of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
to bear/to carry/to hold/to continue/to undertake/to take charge/owing to/due to/to receive

sentences.english: Women in the MENA have the right to inheritance.
sentences.chinese: 中東與北非地區的婦女具有遺產繼承權。

sentences.english: I will not have this slave-girl's son sharing the inheritance with my son Isaac.
sentences.chinese: 我不許這女奴的兒子分享我兒以撒的繼承權。

sentences.english: Here then emerges the historical difficulty of Primogeniture.
sentences.chinese: 這時候，“長子繼承權”就成爲歷史上的難題了。

sentences.english: The direct causation is the fighting for the Chanyu's heirdom.
sentences.chinese: 爭奪單于繼承權的鬥爭直接導致了匈奴的分裂。

sentences.english: A sharp struggle centred on the succession to the throne came along with the death of emperor Tai Zong (Huang Tai Ji).
sentences.chinese: 皇太極去世後，圍繞皇位繼承權展開了激烈的鬥爭。

sentences.english: The state protects according to law the right of citizens to inherit private property.
sentences.chinese: 國家依照法律規定保護公民的私有財產的繼承權。

sentences.english: The eldest sons once held the privileges of patrimonial loyalty and filial inheritance in Béarn.
sentences.chinese: 長子一度能夠世襲爵位，享有優先繼承權。

sentences.english: Then his father abolished his right of inheritance out of spite.
sentences.chinese: 而他父親則出自怨恨廢除了他的繼承權。

sentences.english: Both of these Signs are about resources, including inheritances and property.
sentences.chinese: 兩個星座都喜歡獲取資源，包括繼承權和財產。

sentences.english: Jane and Elizabeth attempted to explain to her the nature of an entail .
sentences.chinese: 吉英和伊麗莎白設法把繼承權的問題跟她解釋了一下。

sentences.english: The old man cast off his prodigal son and disinherited him.
sentences.chinese: 關係，並剝奪了他的繼承權。

sentences.english: You don't mean to disinherit her, do you?
sentences.chinese: 你總不願意剝奪她的繼承權吧？

sentences.english: After the incident his father disinherited him.
sentences.chinese: 那次事變後他父親剝奪了他的繼承權。

sentences.english: There was a dispute about the rightful succession to the throne.
sentences.chinese: 對於王位的合法繼承權有過一場爭論。

sentences.english: His unworthy son was disentitled the right of inheritance.
sentences.chinese: 他的不孝之子被剝奪了遺產繼承權。

sentences.english: You allude, perhaps, to the entail of this estate.
sentences.chinese: 你大概是說產業的繼承權問題吧。

definition: the right to be elected/the right to stand for election
to join an alliance/admission to the United Nations
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
